author: Megan Ellis
title: Watch: Crew 'bully' woman off flight
text:
Watch: Crew 'bully' woman off flight Article By: Megan Ellis Tue, 13 Oct 2015 5:09 PM Share Your Email Credit: burnsie3000/YouTube 
American Airlines' brand has attracted negative attention after a video emerged of a flight attendant forcing a seemingly innocent passenger off a flight. 
The incident occurred on American Airlines Flight 408 and was recorded by fellow passenger Bill Byrne. 
According to the video description, the woman had not heard the flight attendant asking her to move out of the aisle. 
"Tim [the flight attendant] then yelled for her to move and it upset her, yet she still apologized to Tim," the description says. 
"After sitting, the girl mentioned to a different attendant Tim was rude to her. Next thing we know, the girl is thrown off the plane." 
The video starts with the woman telling the flight attendants that they are being mean to her. 
"I didn't do anything," she can be heard saying. 
When the woman doesn't want to leave, a female flight attendant tells the woman that they will call security if she does not leave. 
Fellow passengers seem shocked at the incident, with some remarking that they will never fly with the airline again. 
As the woman leaves the plane, passengers begin booing the cabin crew. 
"You just lost a lot of customers," one passenger says. 
"It was nuts, and that poor woman was so upset. She handled it well, but you could tell it was super embarrassing for her," Byrne told KATU . 
American Airlines told KATU that the investigation is being investigated.
